intro: Bassovia calceolarioides, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble those of the genus Calceolaria. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive pouch-like structure at the base. It is a perennial herb that produces small, tuberous roots, which help it survive in arid conditions.
